subject: Physical Fitness
title: Jane Fonda and the Aerobics Era
description: A quick win: understand Jane Fonda and the Aerobics Era.

hook.text: A Hollywood actress in a leotard and leg warmers made millions of women exercise. Jane Fonda rewrote fitness.

buildup.text: Her 1982 workout video became the best-selling VHS tape ever. Women could exercise at home, privately.

discovery.text: Fonda made fitness socially acceptable for women. Before her, gyms were male spaces; exercise was masculine.

twist.text: She later revealed struggling with bulimia for decades. The fitness icon had a complicated relationship with her body.

climax.text: Despite the contradictions, Fonda's impact was massive. She proved women wanted fitness â€” on their own terms.

punchline.text: One video tape made fitness feminine. The impact lasted decades.

quiz.question: Why was Jane Fonda's workout video so culturally significant?
options: It made fitness socially acceptable for women and accessible at home
It was the first exercise program ever created
